instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SYS_PWORK_R: What is SYS_PWORK_R? This is a typo of SYS_PWROK When you see SYS_PWORK_R, assume they meant to type SYS_PWROK.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
Hey,

I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is struggeling turning on. I have to trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONNOFF_L</SIGNAL> several times until it powers on (same in SMC bypass mode).
When I'm lucky and it turns on I have no USB acticity and no display. 
CPU Vcore is present (1.7V).
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 8.6V
<SIGNAL>SYS_PWORK_R</SIGNAL>: 3.42V
<SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL>: 1.02V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message: already tried a known working BIOS and replaced <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> must go high first.
Check <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL>: 1.02V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL>: 3.42V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>: 3.42V

How exactly the board behaves (LCD connected only):
Fan starts spinning, board is taking~250mA, fanstarts to run faster for a mement, then amperage drop back to 25mA. After few seconds it powers on again, running on 300mA.
But I can't detect any voltage on  <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>   - not even a single spike.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message: Looks like PCH issue; possibly crap accumulated underneath.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message: Heating PCH with flux didnt't helped. Sometimes I'm getting <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> but there is still no USB activity if it is present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message: I found out the board is turning off every time i try to measure voltage on <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_PGOOD_R</SIGNAL>. What could cause this behavior?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
Very likely PCH internal issue.
Any history fault available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
dudipupan check this shiz out: [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-cpu-heats-up-draws-35a.60817/[/URL]

I think we had basically the same issue after all power signals were good.  Missing <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> so the PCH/CPU was in constant reset.
